STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 11, 2021
Kathleen Schultz
Wellspring Lutheran Services Kentwood
1715 Sutherland Dr. SE
Kentwood, MI 49508-5072
RE: License #: CB410201260
Wellspring Lutheran Services Kentwood
1715 Sutherland Dr. SE
Kentwood, MI 49508-5072
Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 5/24/2021-
5/28/2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that
violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 200
121 Franklin Street SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
(269) 330-7082
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB410201260
Licensee Name: Wellspring Lutheran Services
Licensee Address: 4100 Pier N. Blvd Ste. A
Flint, MI 48504-1487
Licensee Telephone #: (989) 262-7386
Administrator/Licensee Designee: Sean De Four, Designee
Name of Facility: Wellspring Lutheran Services Kentwood
Facility Address: 1715 Sutherland Dr. SE
Kentwood, MI 49508-5072
Facility Telephone #: (616) 281-4601
Original Issuance Date: 12/01/1991
Service Types: PLACE CHILDREN FOR ADOPTION
CERTIFY FOSTER HOMES FOR LICENSE
SUERVISE INDEPENDENT LIVING
PLACE CHILDREN IN FOSTER HOME
EVALUATE APPLICANTS FOR ADOPTION

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12312 Foster parent training.
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have training
in and maintain a current certification in first aid from the
American Heart Association or the American Red Cross or other
institution approved by the department.
1 of 8 foster home files reviewed contained documentation that the foster parents
First Aid/CPR certification was expired for 4 months prior to completing re-
certification.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
2 of 11 total open youth files reviewed contained 1 service plan that was completed
outside of the required timeframe. One report was for an open foster care case and
the other for an open IL case.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth and
the social service worker. The contract shall be reviewed and
updated at least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
2 of 3 IL files reviewed did not contain the required contracts.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019
06/4/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 7/21/2020
4

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MISEP violation. Please note that there
are no additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-03E PLACEMENT EXCEPTION REQUESTS AND APPROVALS
Caseworkers must complete a placement exception request
(PER) when there is a need to waive placement standards to
maintain sibling and caregiver bonds or to meet the medical,
emotional, and psychological needs of children in care. PERs
must be completed, reviewed, and approved in MiSACWIS
2 of 8 open foster care case files did not contain approved PER’s for sibling splits.
FOM 722-06B FAMILY TEAM MEETING
P. 5 & 12 & 16
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as outlined in
the following tables:
Case Plan Development/ Reassessment Initial Case Plan (ISP)
- within 30 calendar days before the case plan due date.
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days before the
case plan due date.
Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) - within 30 calendar
days before the case plan due date.
Placement Preservation/ Disruption At least three business days
prior to a planned change of placement or no later than three
business days after an unplanned placement change.
Case Closure Within 30 calendar days before the case closure
date or one business day after unplanned court ordered
dismissal.
Documentation The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is
used to capture family demographics, FTM logistical
information, needs, strengths, action steps, safety concerns and
the safety plan, and any recommendations made for the family
during the FTM. The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be
completed for every FTM.
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in MiSACWIS
using the FTM hyperlink within seven business days of the FTM.
5

8 of 11 total open case files (8FC, 3IL) reviewed did not meet the FTM policy
requirements. One was missing a required FTM and was missing an 1105 for a held
meeting, one was missing two required FTM’s and two 1105’s for held meetings,
one was missing two 1005’s, one contained two FTM’s that did not address the
required youth, one was missing one 1105, one was missing three 1105’s, one
contained an FTM that was held after the required timeframe, and one contained an
1105 uploaded outside of the required timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019
06/4/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 7/21/2020
SIR 2021C0112010 dated 3/21/21, CAP Approved 4/14/2021
FOM 722-08E FOSTER CARE/JUVENILE JUSTICE ACTION SUMMARY
P. 1
The DHS-69, Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary is
used to document specific administrative actions or changes in
a case, including: • Child fatality. • Change in caseworker or
organization. • Change in parent contact information. • Foster
care transfer to adoption. • Change in placement. • Temporary
break from placement. • Program or case closing.
COMPLETION REQUIREMENTS The caseworker must
complete the DHS-69, Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action
Summary and upload to MiSACWIS within the timeframe
required for the specified action/change.
Placement Change - Prior to a planned placement change, or
within three business days of an emergency placement change.
Foster Care/ Juvenile Justice Program/Case Closure -
Within three business days of foster care and/or juvenile justice
program/case closure.
6

5 of 16 total foster care files reviewed (8 open, 8 closed) did not contain action
summaries completed as required. One file was missing an action summary for a
placement change, one file had an action summary for a placement change that was
completed outside of the required timeframe, and three closed files were missing
action summaries for case closure.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019
06/4/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 7/21/2020
FOM 722-08C FOSTER CARE - PARENT-AGENCY TREATMENT PLAN &
P. 4 SERVICE AGREEMENT
Signatures- When completed, obtain all signatures as
appropriate, including those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care
worker, supervisor, foster parent, caregiver, any youth aged 14
and older and in the case of placement agency foster care
cases, the local DHS office designee.
4 of 8 open foster care files contained reports that did not contain signatures as
required. One report was missing youth and parent signature, two were missing
worker, caregiver, and parent signatures, two were missing parent and caregiver
signatures, and eight signatures were obtained outside of the required timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019
06/4/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 7/21/2020
SIR 2021C0112010, CAP Approved 4/14/2021
FOM 722-09 FOSTER CARE - UPDATED SERVICE PLAN
p. 25
Case service plan approval process requires the foster care
supervisor to:
 Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of the
report date.
7

3 of 11 open case files (8 FC, 3 IL) contained service plans approved outside of the
required timeframe. One file contained one report approved late and two files
contained two reports approved late.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019
06/4/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 7/21/2020
FOM 801-03 MEDICAL PASSPORT
For each child in foster care the supervising agency must
maintain a medical passport. Per MCL 722.954c.
For children entering foster care, the initial medical passport
must be provided within two weeks of the child/youth's
placement date to the following
All medical information within the medical passport must be
current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child's
current and complete health information.
Receipt of the medical passport by the above listed parties is
documented in MiSACWIS by uploading the signed and dated
signature page into the Health Profile section.
5 of 8 open foster case files reviewed did not contain medical passports as required.
Three files did not have quarterly updates, two were missing medical passports for
two placement changes.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019 (cited as ISEP 6.49)
06/4/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 7/21/2020
FOM 722-03C OLDER YOUTH: PREPARATION, PLACEMENT, AND
P.1 DISCHARGE
Life Skills Assessment - The Casey Life Skills Assessment must
be completed within 90 days of a youth turning 14, and annually
thereafter. For youth who are 14 or older when they enter care,
the assessment should be completed within 90 days of entering
care.
For youth who are placed in residential, it is the residential case
worker who ensures the Casey Life Skills Assessment if
completed.
8

Placement in independent living may be an acceptable living
arrangement for youth 16 years or older. Prior to placement in
independent living, the caseworker must assess the youth, with
the Casey Life Skills Assessment, as being prepared for
independent living and demonstrate a pattern of mature
decision making.
3 of 3 IL files reviewed did not contain Casey Life Skills documentation.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
 Dates emergency procedures practiced need to be documented in each
home study
 Contacts with the required caregivers with youth in CCI’s should be
documented in case contacts
 All signed documents should include dates of signature
 Contact with secondary caregivers shall be documented clearly in the case
contacts at the required intervals
 FTM’s must be linked to the correct report
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Consultation was provided regarding developing a consistent plan for uploading and
maintaining documents within each case file.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted 5 acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The agency is in compliance with
the following:
SIR 2021C0112010 dated 3/21/21, CAP Approved 4/14/2021
SIR 2021C0112012 dated 1/21/21, CAP Approved 2/1/2021
The agency is not in compliance with the following as noted within the
violations in this report:
5/30/2019 INTERIM, CAP Approved 6/28/2019
06/4/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 7/21/2020
SIR 2021C0112017 dated 3/23/2021, CAP Approved 4/14/2021
Chief Administrator Assessment – I reviewed the Chief Administrator Assessment
dated 5/20/2021 which indicated that while the COVID-19 pandemic restrictions and
staff turnover made compliance difficult in areas such as face to face contacts,
9

obtaining signatures, completing medical passports timely, and conducting FTM’s as
required, the CAP submitted following the 2020 licensing inspection has had a
positive impact resulting in improved compliance overall. The findings of this
inspection corroborate the assessment, with the addition of concerns related to
uploading documentation and completing and approving service plans timely.
CHRI - On 5/24/2021 I virtually viewed the storage of the key and the locked storage
area for CHRI information. I also viewed the dissemination and destruction logs
stored in this secure area.
Other Document Review - On 5/23/2021 I reviewed the agency’s current financial
records, AFPRR, Organization Chart, and case ratios. While the agency has had a
significant reduction in census resulting in a dramatic decrease in revenue, they
were able to maintain financial solvency. This reduction in census has allowed for
compliance with case assignment ratios as well.
Staff Interviews – The staff reported that there have been several
staffing/supervision changes during the year, which has led to adjustments in how
work is completed, but there has been regular communication and support provided
by administration. The staff described issues with documents being uploaded timely
and consistently due to supervisors requiring this be done differently amongst
teams. This was reflected in the files I reviewed.
VII. ANALYST FINDINGS
No Safety Concerns Identified
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules or MISEP requirements and contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
10

June 10, 2021
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 10, 2021
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
